HRComment: Employee received an external offer significantly above internal band; compensation review initiated late.
Employee cited lack of managerial support and sustained workload pressure during exit discussion.
Internal mobility was discussed but timelines did not align with employee expectations.
Performance improvement plan did not meet required benchmarks.
Employee reported prolonged high workload and limited team capacity despite manager intervention.
Contract concluded; employee opted for a permanent role externally.
Market correction led to offer mismatch beyond internal revision limits.
Team dynamics improved post-feedback but trust deficit remained.
